intro: Lappula heteracantha subsp. heterocarpa, commonly known as the heterocarp lappula, is a flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant produces distinctive, inflated fruits that are often lobed and contain several seeds. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in dryland ecosystems.
